text: KIDS and FAMILY mill about in front of an elevated stage bedecked with rows of folding chairs. A giant banner reads: “SOUTHLAND DISTRICT’S 15TH ANNUAL REGIONAL SPELLING BEE.. NEXT STOP, WASHINGTON D.C.!1!!” At the snack table, GUY DUNCAN, disheveled 30s, shoves do into the worn pockets of his shitty blazer.

You must be so proud. I know I am. Guy looks up to see a CRISPLY DRESSED DAD. CRISPLY DRESSED DAD (CONT’D) Aren't kids amazing? Which one’s yours? Guy tears into a donut. An avalanche of powdered sugar fa down his blazer.
(full mouth) Are you fucking kidding me? Guy shambles away, leaving the Dad confused.
A PAUNCHY WOMAN in a SALMON COLORED PANTSUIT steps behind microphone and dartles a smile out into the gymnasium.

OOOOKAY everyone! The Spelling Bee is about to begin so will all of our noble competitors please take their seats up on stage. Parents take their seats down below as the students make their way up on stage. Guy sits between two students up on the stage in the back row. He looks at the OVERWEIGHT BOY, 12, sitting on his left.
Christ. Would it kill you to lose some weight? I barely have any room here. The overweight boy self-consciously looks away. In front, Salmon Pantsuit notices Guy sitting up on stage
I’m sorry, Sir? Guy morosely looks up. SALMON PANTSUIT (CONT’D) (precious tone) These seats are for the competitors, only, so if you can just-
I am a competitor. Salmon Pantsuit chuckles just for a moment. But Guy doesn

Guy stands outside with Salmon Pantsuit and the TWO OTHER JUDGES- a SMALL, BALD MAN, 70s, with huge eye GLASSES and WOMAN, 50s, proudly wearing a BEDAZZLED DENIM VEST. Guys sucks on his teeth as all three scrutinize a shitty tattered PIECE OF PAPER. The Bald Judge puts his huge glasses on, making his eyes big as planets, which startles Guy.
(old man forcefulness) Mr. Duncan, I’m not going to allow it. You are not eligible. In any fashion, way, shape, or manner! The Bald Judge pulls his huge glasses off.
NO, your Honor, YOU'RE OUT OF
(MORE)

Page thirty nine of the Scribbs National Spelling Bee rule book. Rule Twenty Four Sub point B. Quote: “The speller must not have passed beyond the eighth grade on or before February 1, 2011.” That, Sir, is a rule made by YOUR

(re: shitty tattered paper) You’re looking at my transcript! Try not to wrinkle it any more than it is, okay? As you can see, I haven't passed beyond the eighth grade. Not on or before February 1, 2011! Not ever!
That may be but-

-Page sixty nine of the Scribbs Institute National Spelling Bee rule book. Rule Fifty One Sub Point A: “The speller must not have earned a high school diploma or the legal equivalent of a high school diploma.” Guess what, chicken butts? I haven’t! A total of 83 paragraphs, five hundred and eighty one lines of rules in your rule book and I am complying with every stupid one of them!
The Spelling Bee is meant for kids. Not adults who couldn’t even graduate the 8th Grade.
“Couldn't?” “Couldn't?” So now you’re saying you won’t let me participate because you think I’m stupid? Did you just call me fucking retarded?
(flustered) That’s not what I meant at all.

There’s no need for such salty language, Mr. Duncan! SALMON PANTSUIT (CONT’D) You don’t have a sponsor present. Every speller must be sponsored by a nationally published newspaper. JENNY WIDGEON, 30s, approaches.
Guy! There you are! (to Judges) Jenny Widgeon. Daily Probe- Guy’s sponsor. Sorry I’m late.
The Daily Pro- HA! That’s not a newspaper.
Well let’s not argue over semantics, shall we?
They don’t want to let me participate.
(feigning shock, gasps) They don’t want to let you participate?
And they called me a retarded. Jenny pulls out her cellphone. Dials. Waits.
(into cellphone) You were right. Ok. Thanks. Jenny slams her cell off.
What was that? Who did you just talk to?
Lead council of The Daily Probe’s legal team.
They’re more like Piranhas with scorpion tails for dicks than actual lawyers.

As you can guess, the Daily Probe is involved in its fare share of legal suits and boy do these guys know how to gum up the works! So, in about a half hour you will receive a Temporary Restraining Order and Preliminary Injunction prohibiting the continuation of this competition until we clear this whole legal matter up. Jenny cringes, whispers.
Sorry.
Legal matter? This isn’t a legal matter!
It is now. We're suing the three of you personally as well as The Scribbs Institute for discrimination and fraud for the amount of ten million dollars. All the color drains out of the Judges’ faces.
How dare you try to hijack this spelling bee! You can’t do that!
Hmm. Maybe. Maybe not. Again. Semantics. But getting down to the bottom of that will take weeks. Months.

Until then, no spelling bee. Hey, can I at least stay to watch you tell that entire gymnasium full of kids and parents that they won’t get their shot at the Nationals. Salmon Pantsuit nervously looks at the other judges.  She has no choice, it seems.
(resigned) The rules are the rules, I guess. Salmon Pantsuit eyeballs Jenny’s phone. SALMON PANTSUIT (CONT’D) So can you just...
Oh, right. Yes. Certainly. Jenny speed dials her cellphone.
Yep. Yep. Yeeep. Okay. Jenny hangs up the phone.
Well, okay. Looks like we have a spelling bee to get to! Salmon Pantsuit looks like she swallowed a wasp. INT. GYMNASIUM, JUDGE’S TABLE A crowd of concerned parents has bloomed around the table

There’s nothing we can do about the loophole he found. He’s clearly an alcoholic or a drug tweaker. I think the least unpleasant option is to just humor his derangement a bit, let him participate, and when he loses, his pathetic reality of a life will sink in. The best child will win. I assure you. Social justice will prevail. Don’t you all believe in your kids? I do! The parents nod. SALMON PANTSUIT (CONT’D) Then let’s be the bigger people in this situation, mkay?
Brace-Faced girl stands behind the microphone. Bald Glass is the proctor.
Oleaginous.
Oleaginous?
Oleaginous.
Oleaginous. Can I have the definition, please? Bald Glasses shoots Guy a look.
“Having the nature or qualities of oil.” Or “Unctuous; fawning; smarmy.” Oleaginous. Guy subtly scratches his nose with his middle finger.
Oleaginous. Can I have the language of origin?
Latin.
Oleaginous. Does it contain the Latin root “olea” meaning “olive?”
That is correct.
Oleaginous... Brace-Faced Girl starts ghost-spelling the word in her ha
Oleaginous. Can you use it ina sentence?
Oh my God! All the kids sitting around Guy squirm with discomfort.
“The oleaginous man knew he shouldn’t attend the party, but came anyway.
(cough) Koughissmyass.
Oleaginous. Brace-Faced Girl ghost-spells it in her hand again.
Oleaginous.
Oleaginous.
Oleaginous. Can you tell me the part of speech?
Adjective. Guy turns to the Overweight Boy.
No shit it’s an adjective. She ghost-spells it one more time.
Oleaginous. Any other pronunciations?
No.
Oleaginous. O-L-E-A-G-I-N-O-U-S. Oleaginous.

That is correct. Everyone in the room applauds except Guy. Relieved, Brace Faced Girl sits back down. Next, a BOY, 11, with a HUGE MOLE on his cheek walks to t microphone. Guy leans over to the Overweight Boy.
(re: Mole) Hey, if he ever ends up in prison I know what his cell-wife will be aiming for every single time! Am I right? Am I right? The Overweight Boy nervously shifts in his seat.
Recidivism.
Recidivism.
Recidivism.
Recidivism.
Recidivism.
Recidivism. Can I have the definition?
“AR tendency to lapse into a previous condition or pattern of behavior; especially, a falling back or relapse into prior criminal habits.” Recidivism.
Recidivism. Can I have the part of speech?
Noun. Mole ghost spells it in his hand.
Recidivism. Can you please use it in a sentence? Guy turns to the Brace-Faced Girl.
Holy balls, who doesn’t know this fucking word, huh? Jesus. You. Are. All. So. Lame.  10.

R-E-C-E-D-I-V-I-S-M. Recidivism. Bedazzled Vest sadly hits a crude buzzer. The parents in audience “AWWWs” but applauds with appreciation for the attempt. Guy’s laughter erupts over it all. Mole lowers his head Charlie Brown style and walks off th stage. The applause dies down and everyone sits uncomfortably as Guy’s laughter continues to ring through the gymnasium. Back in the seats, Jenny shakes her head from Guy’s obnoxiousness. Finally, Guy finishes, dabs his eyes.
Oh, so pathetic. Hoo... Guy notices everyone’s waiting for him.
Oh, I’m up. Guy moves to the mic. The crowd murmurs. Bald Glasses sighs.
Absquatulate-
(impatient. Quick.) A-B-S-Q-U-A-T-U-L-A-T-E. Guy turns and heads back to his seat.
(Horrified. Surprised.) That’s- That’s correct. Nobody applauds. Just silent shock. Back at his seat, an evil smile creeps across Guy’s face he addresses the kids sitting around him.  11.
I hope all of your pillow cases are waterproof, because tonight they’re gonna be soaked with lots of nerdy little snot tears! Boo hoo hoo...

head_text.subj: GUY RUNS OUT WITH THE GIANT FIRST-PLACE TROPHY TUCKED UND

text: An ANGRY MOB of parents burst out after him, throwing cof cups and donuts. Jenny screeches her car to a stop in Guy’s path.
(half reluctant)

head_text.subj: GET IN IF YOU WANT TO LIVE

text: Guy quickly piles in and slams down the lock. A HOME BAKED MOM hawks an angry LOOGI on the window right level with Guy’s face. As the loogi drips down the window, the Crisply Dressed D rushes the car and screams:
The car peels out of the parking lot just as Crisply Dres Dad launches a fold-up chair, smashing a tail light.
Guy slouches in the seat next to his trophy. Jenny drives like a bat out of hell’s ass.
Did you see that back there?! Total Parentocalypse! You owe me a tail light!  12.
Just watch your driving, will you?
“Grown man goes to National Spelling Bee!" by Jenny Widgeon. Oh, God. This is the only time I wished the nation’s illiteracy rate was even higher.
I’m glad I could help.
Nonono. Thank you! Thank you for walking into the Probe and convincing my editors to help you pull off this craptastic stunt!
(mocking) Wah! I have integrity but the world won't let me show it. Wah!

Hey! I ama real reporter, you get that? I’ve covered presidential elections! I’ve uncovered international corporate scandals! And if it wasn’t for the collapse of the newspaper business I’d still be doing that.
Here’s a headline for you: I DON’T GIVE A DANCING SHIT.
Packing for Washington D.C. is going to be simple for you, isn’t it? Because you just stuff all of your clothes in the hole where your heart would be if you had one. You’re your own carry on!
Jenny’s car speeds away as we pan up to a PASSENGER PLANE FLYING OVERHEAD.
Guy sits with his eyes shut tight. Jenny sits next to him She lowers Guy’s tray and places a tape recorder on it in front of him. Guy opens his eyes.
-..the fuck’s this?
Time for a obligatory interview.
Not now. I’m getting my beauty rest.

Yeah, and it’s really working for you. It is. I mean it. Alright. Where to begin? Hmm. I wonder. Oh yeah! Why are you doing this? Why have you decided, at this late stage in your life, to compete against children in the National Spelling Bee?
Sleepy time. Guy points to his closed eyes.
You gonna make this hard or easy? Guy flips her the bird.
I’ve had bigger challenges than you. Trust me. Guy remains still, his eyes shut. Jenny impatiently snaps her recorder up.

Fine. I’m going to the bathroom. We'll settle this later. Jenny gets out of her seat and storms up the aisle. Guy keeps his eyes closed. Suddenly, an INDIAN BOY, 12, CHAITANYA CHOPRA- as awkward as the day is long- pops up the seat behind Jenny's.
Hi. I’m Chaitanya Chopra.  14.
(annoyed) What?
My name.
Congratufuckinlations.
What’s your name? Guy says nothing. Chaitanya Chaitanya CHAITANYA (CONT’D) What’s your name?
Guy. stares at Guy squeezing his eyes shut.
“Guy” what?
Does it matter?
I’m going to the National Spelling Bee. My parents are up in first class. My Dad says that economy class builds character.
(who cares) Amazing. leans over Guy a bit more, looks out of his window.

You have a great view. I’ve gone to the National Spelling Bee twice before. I overheard you say you're going to the National Spelling Bee, too. You’re the grown-up who’s competing, huh? Guy keeps his eyes shut. Says nothing. CHAITANYA (CONT’D) I heard about you. What was your winning word?  15. Nothing from Guy. CHAITANYA (CONT’D) Your word? Your winning word?
(annoyed) What?
What was the word you spelled to win your regional? To get here? Mine was “Intelligentsia.”
I don’t fucking remember.
Come on, try to remember.
Shit, I don’t know.
Think. You should remember. How can you forget? It’s sucha special word.
(tired) “Autofellatio.”
I’ve never heard of that word. What’s it’s origin?
Loneliness.
No that can’t be right...I know "BRuto” is of Greek origin meaning “self,” right? Fellatio...fellatio fellatio... is that derived from the Latin “fellare” meaning to suck?
(incredibly annoyed) Listen, don’t get your tits ina tangle. It’s just a fucking word. Jesus!  16. Guy closes his eyes again.
Hey, can I trade seats with you? I enjoy sitting next to the window on airplanes.
No.
Why not?
(flustered) Because my seat is over an especially important part of the plane. I move and the plane won’t be balanced and we'll all plummet and crash in a fiery nightmarish death.
(unbelieving) What? Are you sure? Across the aisle, A LITTLE BOY, 7, overhears this. He loo straight ahead and sits rigid, completely freaked out.
Shit. See what you did? Now I got to take an eight-ball piss. Guy gets up.
wooo! I DON’T WANT TO DIE!!! Guy walks up the aisle to the lavatory as FLIGHT ATTENDAN rush past him to the screaming boy.
Sweeping music rises as A Camera pans across an empty mid-western school auditori A COLLAGE of children’s voices start spelling random lett but all at once.

Can you hear the buzz of the bee?  17. Various shots of spellers in moments of victory and defea NARRATOR (CONT’D) The buzz that started long ago. We all have our memories of when we first heard it. Various shots of chairs with numbers. Of dictionary pages flipping. NARRATOR (CONT’D) An old school-time competition is about to capture your imagination. The music starts to swell. NARRATOR (CONT’D) We all have our hometown heroes. But the genius of these competitors is spellbinding. Images of victorious kids pop up one after another. NARRATOR (CONT’D) And like bees to honey, our lust for competition leads us hungrily to the epicenter of this quest for greatness. Images of one teen after another taking the giant check f SCRIBBS COO BILL BOWMAN, 60s- executively handsome for hi age. NARRATOR (CONT’D) The prize is just a word away, and those who compete want to take that check from the Legendary Scribbs coo Bill Bowman. They've dreamed of it all their lives. Images of teens holding up the spelling bee trophy... NARRATOR (CONT’D) And that's why it's the drama of “The Bee." So, can you hear the buzz? Well, can you? The images suddenly turn to MONDAY NIGHT FOOTBALL type graphics as the faint sound of bee buzzing morphs into th robotic WHUP WHUP WHUP of military helicopters as...

head_text.subj: TWO ROBOT WARRIOR BEES FLY IN FROM OPPOSITE SIDES OF THE
SCREEN AND COLLIDE WITH A VIOLENT MECHANICAL EXPLOSION TO

text: Suddenly TWO YUCKITY YUCK ANNOUNCERS appear in the ballro auditorium in front of the stage.

Welcome everyone to the 85th annual Scribbs Institute National Spelling Bee, I’m Chuck Wilde coming at you live from the Historic State Plaza Hotel here in the heart of our country’s only capital, Washington

And I’m Peter Yates. Chuck, over the years the popularity of the National Spelling Bee has grown to sick proportions and this year viewership promises to rival that of any championship sporting event.

You don’t have to spell that out for me, Pete. What can we say? The world loves a good showdown and what. A. Showdown. It will be! Let’s get to know some of this year’s most noteworthy alphabet gladiators! From here on out, all broadcast graphics of names will be produced by these violent mechanical bees blowing things and shooting lasers with their stingers. Thunderous music plays over montages of pre-filmed, in-st shots of competitors standing awkwardly for the camera. The insane graphics and production go totally against the grain of how nerdy they all actually are... JOYCE SACKS, 14 years-old with pigtails, acne and a crook grin.

Joyce Sacks. A fourteen year old spelling assassin hailing from Plymouth Minnesota. Came in 8th last year but this year retreat is not an option. Word has it that she’s been working with three different coaches- one for English, one for Greek and one for Latin- and she’s ready to declare “All your bases are belong to us!”  19. Next, BAXTER FLOURNEY, 9, BRACES and a BOWL HAIRCUT complimented by uncomfortable glances at the camera.

That kid with braces stealing your soul with his death stare? Oh nothing, just nine year-old mind killer Baxter Flourney from Worcester, Massachusetts. His Dad crushed the National Spelling Bee in 1980 at the age of 9. Last year, his older brother Benjamin beheaded first place at the age of 9. And what does this mean? The Bee runs thick in his blood and he’s about spill some of his competition’s! Next, Chaitanya, the boy from the airplane...

Some say that twelve year-old Chaitanya Chopra from Olathe, Kansas has ice for blood. Others say that if you opened up his skull you’d find Stephen Hawking AND Albert Einstein in a mixed martial arts fight. Whatever the truth is, Chaitanya has placed third for the last two years and he isn’t going to take it anymore! He’s focused. He wants it. And word on the street is he’s gonna spine-rip anyone who gets in his way! The graphics explode to reveal ERIC TAI, 14- weird is an understatement.

Don’t let his virgin exterior fool you! Eric Tai from San Diego California is an absolute spelling bee Mongoose! Two years ago, he placed second. Last year, he lost by a syllable to Benjamin Flourney. One syllable! Now, Eric wants to proverbially pop out of the Mekong Delta with a knife in his mouth and disembowel the final round. Next we see a montage of rough video footage of Guy constantly walking away from the camera and flipping the bird.  20.

And finally, in what has been the strangest turn of events in Bee history, we have contestant Guy Duncan from St. Louis, Missouri. Oh, did we forget to mention? Guy's thirty four years-old! This man has made huge waves in the competitive spelling world by exposing and capitalizing on a loophole in the competition’s rules, and OH MAMA! Have things been topsy-turvy! But he’s here and the only way we’re gonna get rid of him is if he loses! Finally, we see quick footage cuts of Scribbs COO Bill Bo all around the world: Spoon feeding a hungry African chil skydiving, Ostrich racing, climbing to the top of a human tower in Sardinia.

And all of this spelling bee action is constantly promoted, lauded, and endorsed by one of America’s most charismatic COOs, Scribbs Institute’s own Bill Bowman. We cut to a LIVE SATELLITE FEED of Bowman, donning an X-G helmet, being harnessed to a zipline that stretches beyon the fiery lip of a volcano!
We have Mr. Bowman joining us on a live feed right now to share a few words.

Thanks Chuck, Pete. I’m sorry I’m not in town yet. I’m at the mouth of the Kilauea Volcano on the island of Kauai, as I zipline across all the major volcanos of the world in my ongoing attempt to raise awareness about the literacy epidemic in America. You know, it’s a lot more dangerous than it looks- and I’m talking about our literacy rate, not the ziplining. But never fear, I’1l make it to Washington in time to hand out first prize to our next National Spelling Bee champion. Who will be the next champion? I don’t know. (MORE )

But I’1l tell you this, you can’t be a Bee champion, unless you've shown honor, sportsmanship and integrity. It’s just impossible. As always, I can’t wait to meet all of our noble competitors. Well, most of them. I/‘11 be arriving with high hopes, as well as that much loved giant check! Bowman turns away from the camera, gives the people aroun him a thumbs-up, and ZIPLINES OVER THE VOLCANO!
Guy and Jenny follow a crisply walking REGISTRATION REP d the hall.

Guy and Jenny enter the office to find NATIONAL SPELLING DIRECTOR BERNICE DEAGAN, 40s, tall, peter pan hair, sitti behind the hotel manager's desk. Director Deagan motions toward the two seats before the d
Have a seat. I’m Bernice Deagan, Director of the National Spelling Bee. (beat) Struthious.
Excuse me?
S-T-R-U-T-H-I-0-U-S. Struthious. That was my winning word. 1973. National Champion. Just thought you should know that. If you didn’t already.
Oh.
Guy. I don’t like you.  22.
Listen-

Now you just shoosh! (beat) You know, when I was a little girl, I was always picked last in P.E. I hated sports. That’s probably what, thankfully, thrust me into the welcoming bosom of the spelling bee. Now, I’m proud to say, we are projected to have more viewers than the Superbowl. That feels kinda nice to say out loud. So how did I accomplish this? Elbow grease? Yes. Hard work? Maybe. Integrity? You betcha. But what I didn’t do is use slimy gimmicks just as yourself! Director Deagan pulls out a competitor number from her de DIRECTOR DEAGAN (CONT’D) So I wanted to personally give you your number... She moves around the table and hangs it around Guy’s neck

You think you’re smart because you found a loophole- and you're taking advantage of it. B-R-A-V-O. But I know you’re not smarter than even the poorest speller in this competition. So may this number serve as the noose you hang yourself by.
Wow. Thanks.
Don’t mention it. Oh, and one other thing. I personally arranged your hotel accommodations for you. Just wanted you to know that.
You shouldn't have.
But I did.  23.
So that all you got? Some sort of weird veiled threat? You could have done that in an e- mail. Jesus. Guy gets up. Jenny follows.
I just thought it would mean more in person.
Not in this day and age! Guy exits.
(calling after him) I’m watching you.
(calling back)
The door slams behind Guy and Jenny.
The place is packed with Bee parents and kids. Guy bulldo his way through. Jenny keeps up.
Hey! Where are you going? The contestant ice cream social is that way! Guy walks off, raising his middle finger as he goes.
(to herself) Wow. What a complete asshole. INT. ELEVATOR —- MOMENTS LATER As the doors start to close, Guy sees Chaitanya running toward the elevator.

Hold the door!  24. Guy doesn’t budge, forcing Chaitanya to wrestle between t doors himself. CHAITANYA (CONT’D) Whew! I made it. Hey, I know you! Guy doesn’t answer. CHAITANYA (CONT’D) You’re Guy, from the airplane. Guy stays silent.
No I’m not.
I’m Chaitanya, remember? Cool. I like words. What’s your favorite word? Guy tries to ignore him. CHAITANYA (CONT’D) Come on. What’s your favorite word in the whole wide world?
I don’t-
-Favorite word?
I don’t have a favorite word.
Mine is “assassin.” It just sounds so cool, you know? Assassin. Assassin. Assassin. Assassin. ASSasSIN. AssASSin. Guy presses the button some more. CHAITANYA (CONT’D) What’s yours?
(shut up) I. Don’t. Have. One.  25.
Of course you do. Everyone does. I bet you even Helen Keller had a favorite word. She was blind and deaf. Everyone’s got a favorite word.
Well, I guess I’m a fucking oddball, then.
I bet Abraham Lincoln had a favorite word. Mark Twain. Neil Armstrong. Charles Schultz. Bill Clinton. Charlie Chaplin...and he did silent films.
NO SHIT! BUT I DON’T!
Well, if you were to have one what would it be?
(gritted teeth) I don’t.
Say you're on a desert island and this Gorilla comes out of the jungle and holds a gun to your head and says, “HOO HOO! Tell me what your favorite word is!” What would you say? Guy gets flustered.
Listen, Chet...Chick...whatever the fuck your name is.
Chaitanya.

head_text.subj: STOP TRYING TO GET ALL UP IN MY

text: Okay. The elevator door opens and Guy angrily pours out.  26.
Before Guy can open the door all the way, it hits the mattress, which is ON THE FLOOR.
What the... Guy fights his way in to see that the gray, tiny room is nothing but a mattress flanked by gray industrial shelves On the other wall stands a deep, mildewed washbasin... AND _NO BATHROOM.
Guy takes a close look at the door. He notices the faded indentation of the words “Cleaning Staff Only” underneath polished brass room number. Guy clenches his teeth.
Guys stands before a BARBIE DOLL FRONT DESK CLERK, 20s.
Unfortunately, the hotel is completely sold out.
I don’t have a bathroom!
(patronizing) Yeah. Ouch.
I_DON’T HAVE A BATHROOM. The front desk clerk crinkles her nose. Guy storms away.
A small, stylish bar.  Guy stands out like a black-nailed thumb amongst this polished, smiling crowd. 27. He spots Jenny sitting at the bar. The only open seat is right next to her.
Bartender. Old Fashioned. If Guy wants booze, he has no choice. He sighs and sits d next to her.
(to Bartender) Make that two. (to Guy) No mini-bar, huh?
No nothing.
I think the Queen Bee is sending you a message.
Damn Skippy.
Man. There are so many parents around here. This place is bursting in the seems with them.
No shit.
Where are your parents?
Oh Jesus Christ. I just want to have a drink in peace. Is that too much to ask?

Listen, I’m trying to make the best out of my situation, okay? I’m supposed to cover you, so I’m going to do it the best way I know how. By asking questions. By starting with the basics. By getting to know you.  28.
Well do me a favor and don’t get to know me. Just report what you see, and leave it at that. Stop trying so hard.
You're like an insolent child hiding secrets from his mother.
Heh, you don’t amount to half the broad my mother was! Guy realizes he just revealed a personal fact. He grimace and curses at himself under his breath. Slugs his drink.
I’m sorry. When did she die?
Fuck off. Jenny flags the bartender.
I’m gonna need another.
I’m gonna need two!
Now several empty glasses sit before Guy and Jenny...
Look, it’s my job! I’m just doing my job.
Is that how you justify being what you are?
What I am? Look at you!
Now twice as many empty glasses litter the bar in front o them. They both stubbornly sit, tipsy and angry.  29.
Look, screw you.
Whatever.
With his pants around his ankles, Guy desperately humps J on his mattress.
Yes. YES! Don’t look at me. DON’T LOOK AT ME! DON’T LOOK AT ME. Guys cranes his head away to the side as far as he can- h face practically presses against the nasty mop sink.
Jesus Christ okay I’m not looking at you!
Guy lies on the mattress on the floor as Jenny hurriedly her skirt back on.
Wow. That was a mistake.
It was great for me, too.

I‘ll...I’11 see you tomorrow. Jenny leaves. Guy spots Jenny’s forgotten underwear on the floor. He pi them up. Shoves them in his pocket.  30. There’s a KNOCK on the door. Guy gets up. Opens the door.
Yeah, if you're so together then why'd you forget your under- Chaitanya standing there, holding a JAR OF NUTS.

Sorry to bother you, but I heard you were still awake. Would you mind helping me open this jar of mixed nuts? Chaitanya peers past Guy. CHAITANYA (CONT’D) Wow. Small room. Guy slams the door in the boy's face. Chaitanya knocks some more. CHAITANYA (0.C.) (CONT’D) Can you help me? TI haven’t had anything to eat all night. I was studying my words so hard I missed room service hours and this jar is too hard for me to open. Guy opens the door.

Oh yeah well we all need something, don’t we? Life is filled with disappointment! Guy grabs the jar and SMASHES IT against the opposite wal He slams the door shut. Guy listens to see if Chaitanya has left.
I...I was wondering if you wanted to be my friend. Guy opens the door.  31.
Listen Slum Dog, I dunno what makes you think that I want to be your friend but you better baba ghanoush that idea right out of your head! Guy slams the door.
Okay. It’s cool. I just thought it would be fun to study together before tomorrow. Drink soda pop from the mini-bar and stuff. Guy opens the door.
Your room has a mini-bar?
Yeah.
What about your Mom...Dad?
My Dad believes that I should learn how to be my own man, and that means staying in my own hotel room myself this weekend.
What...is he in the room next door?
He’s staying at a fancier hotel a few blocks away.
(hell yeah) Bummer.
It's kind of neat. I get to jump on the bed as much as I want. But tonight I messed up and missed room service.

INT. CHAITANYA'’S HOTEL ROOM —- MOMENTS LATER Chaitanya happily picks through the mixed nuts AND BROKEN GLASS- now gathered in a wad of toilette paper- on the ho room desk. Guy leans into the mini-bar and pulls out every bottle of booze there is.
(more focused on his drink) Careful of the fucking glass.
Okay. I will. Chaitanya happily eats a nut. CHAITANYA (CONT’D) I think I know what your favorite word is.
Really.
The “F” word. Guy ponders this. Shrugs.
Maybe.
You say it a lot.
Everyone should.
My father says bad words. But I’m not allowed to. What about your dad?
I never knew my dad. But my mom said bad words a lot. You can say bad words. I don’t give a shit.
I shouldn't.  33.

Do it. Who has the right to decide what is a bad word and what is a good word? Shouldn’t it be that whatever word best expresses how you feel is a good word? Do it. The very thought makes Chaitanya grin. Chaitanya Chaitanya
No.
Stop acting like a little fucking Quaker and do it.
Okay. (relishing every syllable) Mutherfucker. laughs.
Did your soul burst into flames?
Okay. All done.
You’re a real fucking weirdo, you know that? shrugs. Guy pours a mini rum into his glass.
Do you like rum?
I do.
You can be like a pirate with your rum! And if you had a cigarette you could be a total butt pirate!
Don’t ever call me a butt pirate.
Why? You smoke, don’t you?  34.
“Butt Pirate” has nothing to do with cigarettes. Chaitanya blankly looks at him.
You'll find out one day, I’m sure.
Guy sits asleep in the desk chair with his head lolled ba and a rope of drool stretching from his mouth. Chaitanya taps him on the shoulder.
Hey. Hey! Guy starts awake. Chaitanya’s now in a pair of TRANSFORME PAJAMAS. Guy looks him up and down.
The fuck happened to you?
It’s morning. You passed out last night and I was scared to wake you. My Dad will be here any minute, you should go.
Fine. Fuck. Yeah.
Guy shuffles down the hallway. He passes an INDIAN MAN go the other way.
Solemn a lick ‘em. Guy keeps his head low and walks on. The Indian Man turns and looks after him.
Guy and Jenny speed-walk down the hall. Guy stumbles alon completely hung-over.
Did I leave my underwear in your apartment last night?
Who knows?
You look like hell.
I don’t have a shower. An awkward beat.
Baxter Flourney’s in your round. He comes from Bee royalty.
I’m so scared.
Maybe you should be. He’s awesome.
Right. Guy walks in.
Stage lights instantly hit Guy as he enters. Everyone murmurs as he makes his way to the stage.
Chuck and Pete are on the air.

head_text.subj: AND HERE COMES OUR MAN OF MYSTERY

text: Pure drama, Chuck. Pure drama. Ladies and Gentleman of the world, we have all one hundred and fifty competitors, let the Bee begin!  36. Guy passes Director Deagan, who grimaces to herself in disappointment that he made it.
A FAMILY gathers on the couch to watch the Spelling Bee..
Crowds of SHOPPERS cluster around the FLATSCREEN DISPLAY, which is turned to the Bee...
BAR REGULARS order rounds of beer and shush each other as they watch the Bee...
SOLDIERS huddle in a camouflage tent around a small TV th is tuned to the Bee.

Guy finds his seat up on the stage right next to Baxter Flourney. A few rows up sits Chaitanya, who tries to get Guy’s attention to wave at him, but fails. The PROCTOR and JUDGES sit facing them, and a crowd of un parents watch from their seats. Jenny sits in the last se in the last row.
First up, Ling Quan, 13 years old from Pleasanton, Oregon.
Chuck, Ling says when she grows up she wants to be president of the United States.  37.
(chuckling) Not a chance. Pete shoots chuck a look.
...that...there is a single person who wouldn't vote for her. Let’s go to the competition. They both chuckle.
An ASIAN GIRL LING, 13, BRACES, moves up to the microphon
Dactylogram.
Dactylogram?
Dactylogram.
Dactylogram.
Dactylogram. Guy rubs his temples.
Oh God. The Asian Girl ghost-spells in the palm of her hand.
Can I have the definition, please?
A fingerprint.
Dactylogram. Can I have the origin, please?  38.
Dactylogram. From a Greek combination dactylos meaning “fingers, toes.”
Dactylogram.
Dactylogram. Ling ghost-spells in her palm one more time.
I’m in hell. Guy turns to Baxter.
Hey. Wassup. I’m Guy. You’re Baxter, right? Baxter snobbishly looks over at Guy.
I’m not supposed to talk to you.
Why not?
Because my Dad says you’re probably just some unemployed bum trying to steal the prize money that I deserve. And that you’re a cheater.
Really?
Yeah. Guy chuckles at this slight. Baxter inches away. Guy puts his hands in his pocket and discovers he still h Jenny’s underwear. Guy leans over to Baxter and nods out toward the audience.
Well, your Dad’s kind of right. I don’t blame him for being so angry. Do me a favor, will you?  39. Guy pulls JENNY’S UNDERWEAR out from his pocket. Wads it into Baxter’s hand.

Can you give these back to your mom? She left them in my room last night. I'd do it myself but your Dad’s around and who wants to deal with that. Good luck with the divorce, by the way. Divorces suck. Baxter’s snobbish look melts into shock.
What? Stunned, confused, Baxter takes the underwear, takes the news. The audience applauds as LING victoriously takes he seat.
Oh shit, you’re up. Not knowing what else to do, Baxter quickly shoves the underwear into his pocket. Blinking hard, Baxter walks up the mic- the underwear bulging in his pocket.
Next up, probably the next Spelling Bee king, Baxter Flourney.
Pete, Baxter says he wants to be president of the United States when he grows up. And win a Nobel.
Well, shall we cast our votes now?
Noctivagant. Baxter looks out to his parents. His FATHER watches stern while his MOTHER offers a hopeful thumbs-up.  40. PROCTOR (CONT’D) Noctivagant. Baxter blinks back to consciousness.
I’m sorry, can you say the word again?
Noctivagant.
Noct...
Noctivagant. Baxter looks out at his parents again.
Noctivagant....definition?
“Going about in the night; night- wandering.”
Uh...Noctivagant. Can...can you use it in a sentence?

“The noctivagant alley cat kept the entire neighborhood up all night by sitting on the fence, yowling out to her many suitors.” The audience chuckles off this playful sentence. Is Baxte mother chuckling the most? Baxter tries hard to focus. He starts to ghost-spell in h hand, but he can’t concentrate. He sweats. He breathes hard.
Noctivagant. Other pron... pronunciations?
I have just Noctivagant. Baxter swallows hard.  4l.

Noctivagant. N-O-C-T-I-V-I-G-A-N- T. Noctivagant. A delicate DESK BELL tings to alert everyone that Baxter spelled the word incorrectly! The crowd “AWWs” in disappointment. Some gasp. Baxter’s parents erupt with surprise. Crushed, Baxter walks off th stage and down the isle.
The MOTHER on the couch gasps and covers her mouth.
A smile creeps across Guy’s face. Then he starts to laugh
Well Chuck, not everybody is displeased by this shocker... The camera zooms in on Guy’s devilish grin.
Well, Chuck. Now that the room seems to have recovered from that shock, up next, something even weirder...Guy Duncan.
Guy said when he grows up he wants to be a...well, he’s already grown up.  42.
Most people believe that Guy is pulling a stunt, and he’ll immediately strike out here, let’s listen in and see.
Guy heads to the mic.
Frabjous-—
(quick) F-R-A-B-J-O-U-S. Guy turns around and sits back down. He turns to all the kids around him.
(ominous ) Are you ready to get your shit pushed in? The kids all look at Guy in shock.
We pop around to televisions around the world as Guy easi spells his words throughout round one: On a television in a Barber shop...
(quick) F-R-A-B-J-O-U-S. On a television in an executive’s office...
(quick, unceremonious) S-A-N-G DASH F-R-O-I-D. On a television in a retirement home...
(quick)
Director Deagan faces a CROWD of screaming, angry parents her office. She holds up her hands to shush them, and has shout them down.
Listen, LISTEN! WE ARE DOING ALL THAT WE CAN to find a happy resolution to this situation!
Aren't you embarrassed? This is going to go down in history as the most ridiculous national spelling bee ever! And it will be on your head.

head_text.subj: DO YOU KNOW HOW MUCH MONEY I'VE

text: He’s a lunatic! He’s infected!
I swear on my child’s life as God as my witness, this will be the last year you are Director of the Bee.

Look, Mr. Duncan doesn’t possess the discipline and practice that all of your children have. I’m confident he’s not going to make it much farther. I swear on all your children’s lives that if he makes it to the final round, I'll step down as Director of the Bee. Immediately.
Guy lies on Jenny’s bed, a mini rum bottle sticking out o his mouth.
You’re room is bigger than mine. Thanks for letting me shower. I'll get to it as soon as my buzz picks up.
Wow. You thanked me for something. Lemme ask you a question, what is the grammatical significance of the sentence, “Why run from fire ants?”
(barely thinking about it) I dunno. It contains all the vowels in the English language in reverse alphabetical order.
Yeah but that’s a sentence, too bad there isn’t a single word that contains all the vowels, but in alphabetical order.
Facetious. Jenny stands up.
Son of a bitch.
What?
You are brilliant. No, really, you’re a freaking genius!
Fuck you.
Those questions I just asked you? From a test they give to geniuses. And I'd bet you have photographic memory, or something close to it.  45.
I barely went to school. So your big conspiracy theory is shit.

Yeah, well I got hold of your school records. Guess what? Your eighth grade counselor made a note in your file right before you dropped out that you showed signs of genius. Jenny tosses an old manila file onto Guy’s chest. Guy pic it up. Reads it.
Fed-Ex was waiting for me at the front desk. I told you I’m good.

(reading) That fucking fucker. Mr. Leavenworth told me I was a useless loser. And then he secretly makes notes that he thought I was smart. I’m glad I slashed his tires. And let his prized beagle loose.
You display all the social signs of a genius. Antisocial. Outsider. You think you’re better than others. You just never had a chance to shine in school. You never had a chance to realize it.
Boo hoo, I had a bad childhood. Waaah. I never knew my Daddy Waaahfuckinaaaah. You’ sound pretty fucking stupid, you know that?
Sometimes brilliance and photographic memory are inherited. Maybe your Mom was brilliant.
Not likely. She fucking hated it when I had books around. (MORE )
One time as a kid I tried to sign up for the local spelling bee and she completely lost her shit on me for it.
So is that why you're here? To do something you weren't able to do while your mom was alive? Guy realizes what Jenny’s trying to do.
I’m not talking anymore.
You know what? You have problems. You can’t open up!
I have problems? Remember you last night? Now, that was a problem.
(self-concious) So? So?
So?
Well you can stop worrying about it because its never happening again!
Fucking good.
Fine.
Perfect!
Through the frosted glass we see Guy taking Jenny from behind, giving her dramatic thrusts.  47.
Oh God...GOD yes YES...don’t look at me. DON’T LOOK AT ME!
I’M NOT LOOKING AT YOU THE WATER’S
UGH! YES! DON’T LOOK AT ME!
Guy gets dressed as Jenny lies on the bed. He heads for t door.
Guy? Guy turns to Jenny.
But what about your Dad? Guy leaves.
Guy gets to the door of his shitty hotel room, where he f Chaitanya sitting on the floor waiting for him.
Hey Guy! The hotel restaurant is still open. Wanna grab some alimentation for our hyperphagia! (beat) I’m hungry.

Why don’t you do yourself a favor and find some other pre- masturbaters like yourself to nerd out with, okay? This place is crawling with them it shouldn’t be hard.  48. Chaitanya just gives him a blank look.
INT. HOTEL RESTAURANT —- MOMENTS LATER Guy slouches across the table from Chaitanya, completely in thought and fiddling with the salt shaker.
Without salt, civilization would not be the same.
Where are your folks? Shouldn’t you all be eating a dinner of chilled monkey brains or something?

My father rather enjoys the dinner provided in his own hotel. Plus, he encourages me to spend as much time as possible preparing for each round. You want to practice with me? Chaitanya pulls out a HUGE THREE RING BINDER. Starts studying.
Listen, Slum Dog. I’m not here to be your fucking friend.
Then why'd you come with me?
I dunno. Because you look all pathetic and pussified and I can’t stand it. Guy watches Chaitanya happily study.
I’m going to humiliate you up there. I’m going to beat you like a mule.
Not everything is about winning.
Right. You're not here to win.  49.
It’s about the love of spelling. It’s about fun.
Fun?
Yeah.
Reading a bunch of fucking words and roots and all sorts of other wordy shit is fun?
Don’t you think so? Guy scoffs.
Then, you’ve never really had real fun.

One time, for breakfast I was eating waffles, and I thought to myself, “Hmmm this looks like a scrabble board.” So then, without my mother knowing, I opened up a can of alphabet soup and drained all the soup out...and used the letters to play scrabble...ON MY
Chaitanya snickers gleefully.
With who?
What?
Who did you play Scrabble on your waffles with? Against?
Just myself! It was crazy!
You are a flaming nerd. An ANGRY WOMAN walks up to Guy.
Excuse me. I’m the mother of one of the competitors competing here.

I just want to say what you’re doing is an insult to every honest child who worked so hard to be here, including my son.
I have an idea. Why don’t you take said son and shove him back up your rusty birth canal.
How dare you?!
How dare YOU!
No! HOW DARE YOU! Speechless, the Angry Woman marches away. Guy looks at Chaitanya.
Fucking moms, right? Fuck ‘em. Let’s go get a fucking hot dog. This place is depressing me.
I can’t.
Why the fuck not?
My Dad doesn’t want me to leave the hotel.
Your Dad is off having fun without you, like Dad’s fuckin’ seem to do, right? (MORE )
Just running off, having their own wonderful lives. We’re just going for a hot dog. Jesus.
What if he calls to check up on me?

So you miss his call. Say you were on the shitter. Or just say you went fucking out! What’s he going to do? Pull you out of the National fucking Spelling Bee? Come on. Guy leads Chaitanya out of the lobby.
Jenny sits at a table with a cup of joe. JEREMY, 40s, HANDSOME CRISP SUIT sits down across from her.
Jenny Widgeon. How are you?
Jeremy. It’s been a long time.
I’‘ll say. I’m glad I was in town to catch your call.
Wow. You look really, really good. Jenny grabs the sugar and starts pouring lots into her coffee.
Thanks. I’ve been staying away from sugar. Cold turkey. Jenny self-consciously puts the sugar down.
Wow. It shows. How’s the world’s handsomest federal agent doing these days?  52.
It’s not as fun as it used to be. I miss you digging around where you shouldn't be.
Yeah, me, too. Listen, I need to call in “the” favor.

Oh! What a relief. I was hoping that’s why you called. It’s been hanging over my head like giant, Cancerous testicle for years. I like to keep a debt-free lifestyle. Jenny slips Jeremy a napkin with “GUY DUNCAN” written on
Anything you can find would be appreciated.
That’s it? Just a background run?
Yep.
I expected so much more. It doesn’t seem like enough. You saved my ass...my career!
After this we’re even steven.
Just this? No sex? I mean I’m married but I’1l do it.
No.
Or I dunno...I could frame somebody for drug possession...have their records wiped...a mysterious deportation of an annoying neighbor, maybe?
Nope. This is it.
Put someone on the most wanted list? It’s really easy to do.
Not necessary.
Fill their facebook page with kiddie porn?
Really, no.
Well, I’ll take it! A small price to pay. Thanks Jenny.
No, thank you. INT. BEN’S CHILI BOWL - LATER 53.
Sitting across from each other, Guy and Chaitanya chomp C Dogs. Chaitanya smiles with each bite, chili drips all ov his mouth.
This is the best hot dog I’ve ever had in my entire life!
Slow down, Slum Dog. You’ve got fucking chili everywhere. You look like you’ve eaten out someone’s ass.

Ha ha! Funny. You look like there was a person who pooped their underwear and then you paid them five dollars for their pooped underwear and then they sold it to you and then you used it for a bank robber mask and then you threw the pooped underwear away and forgot to wash your face! Chaitanya takes a happy sip of his soda.  54.
You should really not try to insult people. You can’t do it.
This soda pop is so delicious.
Just call it “soda” okay? Otherwise you’re asking to get raped.
Wow. I can’t believe it. I am actually out in Washington D.C.
So?
I’ve never been out before.
Bullshit.
Really. My father says that seeing the sights would prove to be too big of a distraction.
Let me get this straight. This is the third year you’ve been to Washington D.C. and you’ve never left the fucking hotel? Ever?
Yeah.
Well, doesn’t that make you fucking mad?
As my father says, I’m here for the spelling bee, not to be a tourist. Plus, he always brings me back a souvenir.
Wait, while you bleed and shit all over your study words your dad goes and sees all the sights?  55.
One time he got me this cool snowglobe with the Lincoln Memorial in it.
Listen to me. Your life has been total horseshit. You gotta see stuff to know stuff. You gotta really give it to your old man. Don’t let him get away with this!
Get away with what?
Being a selfish asshole.
No he’s not.
I call “Horseshit.” I call it! I’m saying it out loud right now. No wonder you’re such a fucking oddball.
I’ve always liked the word “oddball.” A useful synonym for that is “heteroclite.”
You. Are. A. Fucking. Heteroclit.
(correcting Guy) “clite.”
No, I meant, clit, because that is how you are acting right now. Come on. Finish up. There’s no time to waste. You gotta do shit.
Like what?
How about being a little like a fucking kid, for starters.
Guy and Chaitanya jump over a subway turnstile and dash i a subway car...
With his pant legs rolled up, Chaitanya wades across the and picks up as many coins as possible. Guy encourages hi to pick up more...
Guy and Chaitanya each dash out of the store with a spray paint can in hand...
With his spray paint, Guy scrawls graffiti words “COCK” a “DICK” and “ASS” on the alley wall. With his can Chaitanya scrawls “COPRAPHAGIA!"

After Guy ties the laces of the expensive looking stolen loafers together, he coaches Chaitanya on how to launch t up in the air to tangle them in the overhead power line. Chaitanya gives the shoes a throw, and they catch on the first try. The two high-five underneath the dangling shoe
Guy and Chaitanya are in the back by the refrigerators. G opens a glass door and pulls out a MICKEYS 40. He shoves in Chaitanya’s jacket.  57. The two conspicuously walk out, but get away with it.
Guy takes a swig of the Mickeys. Hands it to Chaitanya. Chaitanya takes a swig. And chokes. COUGH! COUGH! COUGH!
Easy there, Slum Dog.
Wow. I think that went all the way to my balls.
Hell yeah, it did.
I said “balls.” Guy takes another swig. CHAITANYA (CONT’D) I like having you as a friend.
I’m not your friend.
I really don’t have any friends at home. At first, I thought being good at spelling would get me friends, but kids just make fun of me more. I hate being picked on.

You know, when I was a kid I moved a lot, running with my mom from credit collectors, ditching apartments to avoid the rent...I was never in one place long enough to have any friends. Guy remembers, snickers... Chaitanya pulls a TOY TAXI CAB out of his pocket, rolls i the step.  58.
What the fuck is that?
(sheepish) I grabbed it in the liquor mart. CHAITANYA (CONT’D) Toys are fun to have when you can’t play with other kids. What was your favorite toy as a kid?

I had a toy car once. It was this shitty little matchbox police car. It never left my pocket. But one night, as we were ditching this one apartment, it fell out of my pocket in the dark. I never saw it again. So yeah...no toys. No friends.
I don’t really have friends, either. It’s hard to have friends when you’re always studying.
Jesus. That wasn’t my problem.
Well, I’m your friend now. This catches Guy off guard and he needs to avoid it.
So tell me, Chaiwala, you got a girlfriend? I was just joking. I know you don’t have a girlfriend.
You don’t know that!
Yes I do. If there’s anything I know, it’s that you don’t have a girlfriend.
Well, maybe I don’t have a girlfriend, but I’ve felt a girl up, before.
Oh yeah?  59.
Yeah!
I’m not talking about hugs with grandma.
No! Not my grandma, a real girl!
Oh, a real fucking girl! I get it, now. Guy points the Mickeys up at the statue of Abraham Lincol
You know who that is, right?
Lincoln.

He fucking died so that you could feel up any type of girl you want. (beat) Point is, you’re Indian, right? But thanks to that guy, if you wanted to feel up, say, a white girl, they can’t arrest you. Because you're fucking equal. Thanks, Lincoln!
Thanks, Lincoln. Okay, I’ve never felt up a girl.
No shit you haven't. Fucking liar.
