I bet. Guy takes another swig.
I just hope I get one with nipples. Guy chokes a bit.  60.
What?
I just hope that the first girl I feel up has nipples.
Every girl has nipples.
Well, you must be very lucky then. But every girl does not have nipples. No.
Why in the fuck do you think that not all girls have nipples?
Just look around at any girl walking by! Look at their shirts. On some you can see the little...nipples poking through their shirt. On others...there’s nothing.
Oh sweet Jesus. You’re in bad shape, you know that?
Every time I think about it I get worried. I also worry that if I am lucky to get a girl with nipples, I hope they’re round.
You know what? Let me help you put your mind at ease. Come on.
Where we going? Guy leads Chaitanya off the Memorial steps.
Guy walks with Chaitanya.  61.
Where are we going?
Just fucking hold your horses. If my old man was around, I wish he did something like this for me.
Are we getting a sundae? I could really go for a sundae right now. Guy pulls Chaitanya into an alley.
Okay. Stay here. Don’t fucking move.
Are you going to get ice cream cones?
Fucking NO with the ice cream! Just wait here. Guy disappears out of the alley back onto the street.
We follow Guy as he spots a PROSTITUTE standing directly under a sign that reads, “PROSTITUTE FREE ZONE.”
Guy returns with the prostitute. Chaitanya, who was leani against the wall, straightens up.
Slum Dog, I want you to meet Marzipan. Marzipan, Slum Dog.
Hi.
You said he was sixteen!  62.
He is sixteen, he just has a hydro- thyroid retentional problem. You know, like Gary Coleman.
Oh, jeez. God rest his sweet, funny soul.
Alright, Chaiwala. All I can say is, “You're fucking welcome!”
For what? Marzipan PULLS UP HER SHIRT. Chaitanya’s eyes go wide as wagon wheels as he stares at Marzipan’s naked tits.
...three...four...five...six... seven...eight...nine...ten. Marzipan lowers her shirt. Guy pulls out a ten dollar bil from his pocket. Hands it to her.
Here.
What, no tip?
Don’t ask for the only ten I got and then I’1l have something to tip you with next time. There’s a tip.
Asshole. (to Chaitanya) Bye sweetie. Good luck with your glands and shit. Marzipan leaves the alley. Chaitanya hasn’t moved a muscl since the tit unveiling.
I actually lied, I have a couple more bucks. You wanna get ice cream?
Fuck the ice cream, I want to grow up right now!  63. They both leave the alley.
The sleepy DESK CLERK watches as Guy and Chaitanya drag t exhausted bodies across the lobby to the elevator.
Guy and Chaitanya both lean against the back of the eleva
Chaitanya stops at his door. Guy keeps shuffling on.

Hey, Guy? This was like, the best night of my life. Are we friends now? Without turning around, Guy flips Chaitanya the bird, and steels a small smile to himself, but keeps on walking to room. CHAITANYA (CONT’D) Cool. Chaitanya, opens his door, where we see his father, the Indian man from before, sternly waiting for him inside. H goes in and the door closes.
Jenny and Guy walk down the hall to the next round. Guy keeps looking at Jenny, but whenever she looks at him, he looks away.
Fuck it. Yes, it was just me and my mom growing up. Life sucked, and then she died last year. It’s as simple as that.
I think you like me.
What? Don’t flatter yourself. You just suck at your job and I’m tired of watching you beg. Chaitanya approaches them.

Guy! I wanted to give you something before the round starts. For good luck. 64. Chaitanya hands Guy his toy taxi that has been crudely converted with black and red markers, into a police car. This is the first time we see Guy being touched by anythi
Thanks.
I’m going to totally bust your nut.
No, you don’t mean that.
I do!
The nut busting...It’s not what you mean...I’m not...just say you’re going to kick my ass.
Okay. See you in there!
What was that all about? Guy puts the toy car in his pocket.
Let’s go spell some fucking words.
And welcome everyone who’s tuned in to watch Round Two of the Scribbs Institute National Spelling Bee. I wonder what today will offer, Pete?
Ninety Nine problems, but I’m sure a misspelled bitch ain’t one of them, Chuck.
INT. HOTEL AUDITORIUM PROCTOR’S TABLE - SAME TIME Director Deagan leans over to the Proctor.
Sorry. There was an error with the randomization programming, I need to give you the fix before the round.
Okay. Director Deagan inserts a USB stick into the Proctor’s computer and uploads the program, with a devilish smile.
Guy sits among the competitors, in his own personal hell, Round two drones on. A KOREAN BOY with Cowlick Hair stand in front of the mic.
Rhapsodize... can I please have the definition?
“To talk with extravagant enthusiasm.” Rhapsodize.
Rhapsodize. Any other pronunciations? Guy sees Joyce Sacks sitting in front of him. He taps her the shoulder.  66.
Excuse me. Joyce turns.
That's your Dad out there in the audience, right?
Yeah. Guy pulls a pair of HIS OWN UNDERWEAR out of his pocket.

This is kind of embarrassing, but he left these in my room last night and I don’t want to humiliate him by handing them back myself. It was just horseplay, I swear. (beat) He truly loves your mom. With horror, Joyce takes the underwear and stares at it f long beat. Tears well up in her eyes. Her lower lip quivers. Joyce stands up out of her seat. All eyes are directed at her as she points out into the audience at her father.
(shrill)
Joyce storms off the stage. Guy smiles, pleasantly surprised. All the other kids remain seated, somewhat rattled. Joyce’s parents get up and run after her.
Annnnd end scene! Unbelievable! Joyce Sacks flames out without misspelling a single word!
Pete, she caved like a skull hit with a ball peen hammer, Pete.  67.
I'd hate to have a look in your freezer.
I, um, apologize for that.
It’s okay. R-H-A-P-S-O-D-I-Z-E. Rhapsodize.
That is correct. The audience applauds.
AND LEE PARK HITS A BULL’S-EYE!
Maybe one day Lee Park will have a park named after him. The “Lee Park Park.” And then they can add a park and ride adjacent to it. The “Lee Park Park Park and Ride.” Something to be proud of, Chuck.
Yeeesss.
It's Guy’s turn. He turns to the kids as he gets up.
I hope you’re fuckin’ ready, because I’m about to get all Optimus Prime on your asses. Guy steps up to the mic. He watches as the Proctor’s eyes WIDE for a moment.
The audience gasps. Guy pauses.  68.
Can you spell Uh-oh, Chuck?
Chances are I can spell it better than that word!
Damn it.
Director Deagan smiles. Leans forward in her chair.
Guy steps away from the mic for a moment. Paces. We think he’s panicking. But then he spots something in the back o the auditorium.
Thank God. I was worried there for a second. Guy waves to the back of the auditorium. Everyone turns around to find a wide-eyed WAITER from the hotel bar, hol a MARTINI.
Yeah, that’s me... Unsure, the waiter walks up the aisle to the stage.
UN. BELIEVABLE! Guy is pulling a Thurston Howell the Third right here at the Bee! Director Deagan makes a B line to the Judges’ table.
Looks like Director Deagan doesn’t agree with Guy’s methodology.  69.

But I can tell you right now, Chuck, that Deagan’s gonna come up dryer than Grandma's sex toy on this one. There is no rule that states a contestant can’t drink during a round- because usually the contestants are under the legal age to drink.
Who’s Afraid of Virginia Wolfe? Not this fella! After quietly conferring with the Judges, Director Deagan throws her arms up in the air and storms back to her seat
Guy watches Director Deagan go and then bends down to the waiter, takes the Martini.
What’s the damage?
Eleven dollars.
ELEV- there better be like, angel semen in this drink, or something. The audience gasps as everything Guy’s saying is being pi up by the mic. Guy plops his room cardkey in the waiter’s hand.
Here, put it on the room account, and check back every once in awhile. I’m gonna dry out real fast.
Yessir. Guy leans into the mic.
Oh yeah. Sorry. (fast) (MORE)
Guy unceremoniously returns to his seat with his drink.
(unbelieving) Correct.
Director Deagan crosses her arms with a huff.

We cut between Guy and the other competitors standing at mic. Guy spells lightning fast every time, and simply tur back to his seat, cocktail in hand, knowing he spelled correctly. The others pause, ghost-spell in their hands, spell with uncertainty. Angry viewers around the world boo and throw stuff at the TVs every time Guy is up...
Ss.
Can I have the root origin please?
Pertinacious. Can that be used in a sentence please? As Chaitanya spells we see Guy very subtly spelling along with him...almost with encouraging enthusiasm.
This is amazing! The luck of the draw is not going Guy’s way as it seems he’s getting every mile-long word in the English language!!!
Hagridden. H-A-G-R-I-T-T-O-N. Ting! The girl’s face falls.

Ting! He's out. His lowers his head. Ting! Another girl is out. She turns to walk off as her face sours into a big sob. Ting! Another boy is out. He smacks his forehead and walk away. Ting! And another. He turns and leaves. Ting! And another. He turns and leaves.
(burp spells)

(horrified disappointed) That is correct. One clap can be heard in the back. Coming from Chaitanya. Guy spells one word after another...with more physical fl each time. By his last word, Guy’s busting ELVIS KARATE KICKS on his back to his seat. END MONTAGE.
The pack of angry parents surround Director Deagan as she fights her way through.
He’s in the final round! Director Deagan looks to all the angry parents.
Okay, well, obviously I’m not going to resign. That would leave the Bee rudderless in this storm!

The crowd of parents grow loud with protest. Director Deagan, for the first time, looks like the pressure is getting to her. Elsewhere, Guy exits the ballroom amid very harsh stares. Chaitanya catches up with Guy.

Alright! We're both in! Top twenty five! Chaitanya tries to hi-five Guy but misses and hits his ch Jenny approaches. CHAITANYA (CONT’D) I’m going to kick your ass. You want to eat dinner together? And then maybe study or something?
Yeah. I don’t know, maybe.
Meet me in the lobby in like, an hour.
Yeah, alright. Chaitanya saunters off.
Did I just see what I just saw?  73.
What?
You have a friend?
Look. he’s an incredibly annoying kid and the only way to keep him from driving me insane is to deal with him.
Do you have a little buddy?
Hey! It’s none of your business, okay?
Okay! I was just joking. Have all the friends you want!
I will! I gotta go study. Guy storms away. Jenny calls after him.
I know you’re not studying you don’t study! Have fun with your buddy!
Guy walks past the gift shop. Pauses. Turns to go in.

Guy stands in front of the magazine stand. Contemplating. With a smile, Guy grabs a Playboy Magazine. Guy passes the freezer. Then returns to quickly grab a pi of ice cream. Guy plops them both down at the register. The OLD LADY CLERK, 80s, raises her eyebrows.  74.
Gettin’ ready for a wild night, huh? Guy slaps down money, sneers and leaves.
Guy approaches Chaitanya’s hotel room. The door is slight ajar. He’s about to knock when he hears Chaitanya’s Dad. CHAITANYA’S DAD (0.S.) Just make sure he’s locked in, okay?

Dad. He’s totally locked in. He's took me around to see the sights last night! Something you’ve never done, by the way. CHAITANYA’S DAD (0.S.) Chaitanya, focus. This man is your enemy. Keep him close but don’t forget that. Remember Donnie Brasco. You want to win? Do you?
Of course! CHAITANYA’S DAD (0.S.) Then make best friends with him! Get him so that he couldn’t bear to beat you!

Dad, I got it, okay? No problem. Guy’s face falls. He walks away. Further down the hall we see Guy lean an arm against the wall for support. We see shoulders heave once- and once only. Guy hurls the ice cr down the all, then continues on.
Guy waits in the lobby, with the bagged magazine in hand. Chaitanya approaches.  75.

head_text.subj: WERE YOU PRETENDING TO BE MY FRIEND
JUST TO TRY TO BEAT ME

text: What? No! No!
Plying me with booze? Earning my trust? Huh?
Listen, I can explain.
And what about last night, huh? Thought you’d make me tired? Become best friends along the way so I wouldn’t want to beat you?
Listen, I know it’s weird but-
You little shitwit just admit I was your damned mark! Chaitanya hems and haws.
-IT WAS MY DAD’S IDEA, OKAY? He felt you were the biggest threat. The wild card. But I really like you.
Liar.
It was the truth that I’d never left the hotel before last night. It was truth that you and I became friends!
All so that you could win.

No. Yes. Well, no. The getting you to lose part was my Dad’s idea but you’re cool and I like you. You showed me my first boobs! Guy turns away. Chaitanya scurries around to face him.  76. CHAITANYA (CONT’D) Do you want to see a friend lose? My Dad will be so disappointed in me. Guy takes out the toy cab/police car Chaitanya gave him, drops it on the floor and crushes it with his heel.
Fuck you sideways, Chaiwala! Guy storms out of the lobby.
Chaitanya chases after Guy.

Guy! Guy! As Guy walks off a MASKED ASSAILANT with a PIPE rushes Gu WHAP! WHAP! WHAP! Right at the knee! Guy crumples to the ground, screaming. The masked assailant stands over Guy, then freaks and spi and dashes off- DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF AN ONCOMING TAXI CAB. The cab slams on its brakes, sending the Masked Assailant rolling over its hood. A crowd quickly gathers around the commotion. The cabbie gets out of the cab and approaches the Masked Assailant, out cold on the street. The cabbie removes the mask. IT’S DIRECTOR DEAGAN!
Police, paramedics, and looky-loos surround the scene. Director Deagan, now handcuffed on a gurney, is being lif up into an ambulance.  77.
He’s the one you should be arresting! He’s a bad man! A B-A-
The ambulance doors close and the ambulance drives off. Jenny sits with Guy, who now has his knee wrapped in ice.
I’m going to go talk to your buddy. Guy’s holding a death stare on Chaitanya, who stands off the distance with his father, talking to the police.
He’s not my friend and don’t go fucking talking to him! Chaitanya nervously glances over at Guy. The moment is tense.
I need to.
Do it and I’1l go talk to ESPN. I‘1l totally open up.
Try me. Guy limps away. Jenny's phone vibrates. She has an e-mail alert. It reads “Jenny- Guy Trippon info. We're even! Jeremy.” Jenny opens up the e-mail on her phone. Reads. Her eyes g wide.
Chaitanya studies from his huge binder. His phone rings. picks it up.  78.
Hello?
Yes, your father left a message saying he’1ll be waiting for you in the lobby in five minutes.
(confused) Really? Thanks.
Chaitanya walks out of his room. Before the door shuts completely, GUY silently limps inside from behind a nearb planter.
Chaitanya looks around the lobby. No father. Chaitanya freezes- a horrible thought has just crossed hi mind. Chaitanya runs for the elevator.
Chaitanya runs as fast as he can to his room.

Chaitanya scrambles inside...HIS BINDER IS GONE! Chaitanya notices a flickering reflection from his window Chaitanya looks out his window to see Guy below in the parking lot, standing next to the BURNING BINDER! Guy loo up and flips Chaitanya the double bird.
There is a knock at Guy’s door. Guy limps over to and ope it to face a PIZZA DELIVERY GUY holding TWENTY PIZZA BOXE  79.
That will be two hundred and eighty dollars, not including tip. Guy grits his teeth and slams his door.
Amateur.
There’s a knock on Chaitanya’s door. He opens it and is greeted by MARZIPAN.
Hey, Sugar! Suddenly ANOTHER HOOKER APPROACHES.
What are you doin’ here, bitch?!
This is my hood, bitch!
Chaitanya slams his door shut, completely freaked out as two prostitutes wage war out in the hallway.
Guy jumps awake to his door being rapped hard.
D.C.P.D. Open up, Sir.  80.
Yeah, right! Nice try Chaiwala! Who’d you hire, the doorman?
Sir, we've received a call that you’re holding someone against their will in your room, open the door or we will open it for you. Guy sits up in bed. Decides to play along.
That's right, coppers! I've got a hostage! And I'll do her if you get any closer! Then, I'1l fuckin’ do myself, you hear?! Guy listens, footsteps hurry away from his door.
Complete fucking amateur.
Guy lies asleep on his bed.
The door splinters open!
Huh...whah? A horde of SWAT stumble into the room and on top of Guy.
Jenny walks out with Guy.
That little fucking bastard!
Hey, at least they didn’t press charges.
He knew I wouldn't believe it was the real cops. It’s war!  81.

Guy. I gotta talk to you about something. I’ve been digging around and...I found out who your father is. Maybe...just stop walking for a second. Jenny stops Guy. Looks into his eyes. Takes a deep breath
As incredible as this sounds, Guy, your father is Scribbs President Bill Bowman.
Yeah. I know.
Wait, what? You do?

My mother told me when she was dying. He was a traveling encyclopedia salesman, she was a waitress at a diner he passed through all the time. When she got pregnant he stuck around for awhile or something, but once I was born, he headed for the hills and never looked back.
So Bowman doesn’t have any idea who you are-
-Not a fucking clue. And he’s not going to until I finish making a mockery out of what he seems to love more than anything else, the spelling bee.
Guy! This is huge.
It's not important to your story, if that’s what you’re trying to drive at.
Like hell it isn’t! This is completely important. Everything else falls to the wayside for this. (MORE )
This is now the whole point of my article.
No fucking way.
Look, not wanting me to get a quote from some kid is one thing, but you can’t really tell me what to write.
I’m doing it right now.
I like you and I thought you liked me, but nothing gets in the way of me doing my job well.

Are you kidding me? Nothing gets in the way of your shitty little tabloid piece? Spare me. Why don’t you knock off this professional reporter act. You write for a scabby rag that fat housewives wash down with a pint of ice cream every week. Jenny’s clearly stung by Guy’s words.
If you write one word about this, I‘1l never talk to you again!
IT HAS TO BE! You just do what you have to do and I’1l do what I have to do.
Whatever. You fucking ingrate! Jenny scoffs. She’s so enraged she’s speechless. Jenny storms off. Guy watches her go, angry, yet torn by tinge of regret.

And welcome everyone to the big tamale, the final countdown, where the eye meets the tiger! Pete, if you thought the going got weird during the Bee yesterday, just listen to what happened when the semi-final round was over. Reports have come in that National Spelling Bee Director Bernice Deagan has been arrested and charged with assault with a deadly weapon, on none other than Guy Duncan!
She tried to Tanya Harding him, Chuck. With a pipe. Anda ski mask. Allegedly. Much to America’s disappointment, Guy only suffered minor injuries and will be competing in the final round.

Un. Believable. This morning Scribbs COO Bill Bowman announced that Director Deagan has been removed from her position and that he himself will oversee the final round today. And we are fortunate enough to have Mr. Bowman with us, in Washington D.C., right now. Bowman steps into frame.

Thank you, Chuck. I would like to take the opportunity to address this unique situation to everyone watching out there. I regret the alleged actions of former Director Bernice Deagan. As you know, I myself am a former bee champ. Before I became one of the most influential and powerful executives in America, I learned first hand that the bee is about sportsmanship, not assault and battery. I look forward to moving past this ugly incident and am very excited to personally crown our next National Spelling Bee Champ, whoever that may be. 83.  84.
From your lips to God’s ears. Pete, take it away.

So let’s get to it! The final round of this year’s Scribbs Institute National Spelling Bee, where the last speller standing walks away with five hundred thousand dollars- Bowman leans in to interject.
-And a lifetime supply of dictionaries and encyclopedias-
-blah blah blah FIVE HUNDRED

All twenty five competitors sit up on the stage as the ju and audience and Bowman sit before them. Disheveled and worse for the wear, Guy limps past Chaitan who’s wearing a blazer that has one sleeve obviously long than the other.
What happened to the duds? Looks like a “friend” got hold of them. Chaitanya’s tired and grumpy.
You got arrested.
I’m going to fucking end you.
(through gritted teeth) Bring it.  85.
Looks like there’s some harsh words being shared between two of the contestants down there, Chuck.
Eric Tai walks up to the mic. He’s super awkward, nearly savantish with his rocking back-and-forth.
This is Eric Tai. Quite the word Ninja.
Yes. If a Chinese person could be a Ninja.
Inchoate.
Inchoate.
Inchoate.
Can I have the definition, please?
Presenting favorable circumstances or conditions. Inchoate.
Inchoate. Part of speech, please?
Adjective.
Inchoate. Eric ghost-spells in the palm of his hand.
Inchoate. I-N-C-H-O-A-T-E. Inchoate.
That is correct. 86. The audience goes wild. Eric pumps his fist in just about the nerdiest way possible, and returns to his seat. Next, Chaitanya comes up to the mic. Guy leans forward in his seat.
Chaitanya Chopra, Chuck. Chaitanya has been here twice before and hopes three times is the charm.
Let’s see if the genie’s in his bottle, Pete.
That might have been a skosh culturally insensitive.
No more than calling a Chinese kid a Ninja. Let’s listen in...
Tmesis.
Tmesis. Definition?
“In grammar and rhetoric, the separation of the parts of a compound word, now generally done for humorous effect; for example, ‘abso-bloody-lutely.’”
Is the origin from the Greek “a cutting?”  87.
Yes.
Tmesis. T... Chaitanya pauses. Guy leans forward even more. CHAITANYA (CONT’D) ...M-E-S-I-S. Tmesis.
That is correct. The audience applauds loudly. Guy skoffs.
That was FAN DASH FREAKING DASH
Chaitanya returns to his seat. Guy glares at him. A HARELIPPED GIRL, 14, approaches the mic.
This is Tamara Sweetzer. (beat) She has such a kind soul. So bright.
Zeitgeist.
Zeitbeist?
Zeitgeist.
Z-I-T-G-E-I-S-T. Zeitgeist. Ting. The audience “AWWWs.”  88.
Ouch. The wheels came off of that wagon. Too rushed. Wayee to rushed.
Pete, all the Bee veterans will tell you, “Take your time. Even if you think you know it, ask those questions. Spell it out in your hand.”
So right. You want to be the tortoise, not the hare.
Wow. That one was the most insensitive of all. I can’t believe you went there.
What? “Hare” as in rabbit, not “hare” as in...lip!
We should just drop it.
Tamara rushes off the stage in tears.
She spelled it Zitgeist! What a retard! Guy is next. As he approaches the mic there are boos and hisses.

And here comes Guy Duncan. The booing grows. Guy happily stands before his haters. Guy looks down at Bowman. Bowman looks up at him, with no idea what's going in Guy’s head. This is the first time G has ever stood before his father. We see a slight change Guy's face- almost a tinge of emotion.  89.
Holy smokes! I don’t think there's ever been booing at the Bee before, Chuck.
Well, there’ve been a lot of Bee firsts this year.

head_text.subj: WILL NOT PROCEED UNTIL THERE IS

text: The crowd quiets down. PROCTOR (CONT’D) Thank you. Condign.
Can I have the definition, please?
“Wel-
Just kidding C-O-N-D-I-G-N. Guy mimes jerking off and blows raspberries in the mic, t returns to his seat. An explosion of boos erupt.
That is corr- (over the boos)
Guy turns to the BOY WITH A UNIBROW sitting to his right.
They're fucking animals. Your parents are fucking animals. Unibrow gets up. It’s his turn.
Slubberdegullion.
Slubberdegullion.
Slubberdegullion.  90.
Slubberdegullion. Can I have the definition, please?
Yes. “A dirty, wretched slob.” The Raging Mother from before stands up in the audience a points at Guy.
The audience laughs and cat calls Guy.
Ma’am. I’m going to have to ask you to leave.

Not until he does! The Proctor nods and two security guards approach the Rag Mother. She goes limp and they have to drag her away. As she gets dragged out she starts chanting: RAGING MOTHER (CONT’D) Take him out! Take him out!
Well, we promised fireworks, ladies and gentleman!
Is this a Spelling Bee or the G8 Summit?!
Zing! Zow! Petey’s back! Soon, everyone in the audience is chanting “TAKE HIM OUT! Guy seems unaffected by all this. Guy leans in toward the rest of the contestants.

Get ready, mongoloids. This only makes me stronger... We hold on the contestants up on the stage as Guy stands before the mic.  91. Through quick cuts we see the number of contestants dwind down, until finally there are only three. ERIC TAI, CHAITANYA, and GUY.
And then there were three. Eric Tai, Chaitanya Chopra and Guy Duncan. They will fight to the finish, when we come back!

You may stand and stretch your legs during this commercial break. Guy looks at Eric Tai who has met his parents at the foot the stage. His equally awkward father approaches to give encouragement. Then Guy looks at Chaitanya who is now huddled with his parents. Guy watches as Chaitanya’s mother rubs his back, his father gives him quiet words of inspiration. Guy looks across the auditorium to Jenny. She turns her b to him and interviews one of the angry parents. Guy sits completely alone up on the stage. He looks at Bowman, talking to the Proctor, then he turns back to Chaitanya with his parents again. Then back to Bowman. Guys blinks wearily. A change is happening inside of him. PROCTOR (CONT’D) Okay everyone, ten seconds. The three finalists must now sit together.
Eric, Chaitanya and Guy all sit side by side. Eric Tai goes up to the mic. Guy glances at Chaitanya, thinking hard.  92.
And here we go, what might be the final leg of the competition.
Kopophobia.
Kopophobia. Can I have the definition?
“Fear of exhaustion. Otherwise known as “Lexicographer’s Curse.”
Is it derived from the Greek “Kopos” meaning “fatigue?”
Yes.
(beat) No! Ting! The crowd erupts with upset! Eric sadly leaves the stage.
OH THAT’S GOTTA HURT! Eric knew he left out the H. This has been a long day and it’s clearly taken it’s toll on Eric.
How ironic that fatigue made him misspell a word about fatigue.
That one will haunt him for life. And he’s just a kid, so that’s a long time to be haunted by something. Long time. And now, Guy Duncan. Guy steps up to the mic, amidst boos.
Guy stops. He turns to Chaitanya. Then back to the mic.
Guy takes a disgusted sigh. He’s decided what he must do.
Ting! The audience goes crazy with glee. Chaitanya looks Guy with shock. Bowman applauds.
Well what do you know! For the first time this whole tournament, Guy Duncan has spelled a word incorrectly!

But, the rules of the final round dictate that because he’s one of the final two remaining contestants, Guy remains on stage. Guy sits back down. Looks at Chaitanya, who stares at Guy with amazement, all pretense of anger has washed away.
I know how bad you want this. I get it. So take it. Fuck off. Chaitanya slowly gets to the mic. The audience wildly cheers.
The entire family screams for Chaitanya.
The bar goers all tense up while they watch Chaitanya at mic.
All Chaitanya needs to do now is spell his next word correctly and he’s the new champ.
Infinitesimally.
Infinitesimally. Can I have the definition?
Yes. “Exceedingly small.” Chaitanya looks back at Guy. He knows this word. But on his face that he’s feeling guilty.
Infinitesimally. E-N-F-I-N-I-T-E-Ss- I-M-A-L-L-Y. Ting! The crowd erupts with displeasure.
Oh my. Well, a spelling bee can’t be won on an incorrect word, so ‘round we go again. Chaitanya sits down next to Guy.
Fuck you, Chaiwala.
If you think everything I said was a lie, then I’1l prove it to you. It’s not about winning to me...anymore. Guy goes to the mic.
Rugose.
Ting! Guy sits back down. cur
The troops all cheer for Guy’s misspelling. cur
we see
You know these words. Chaitanya gets up to immense applause. Ting!
Pejorative.
P-E-J-O-R-A-T-E-V-E. Pejorative.
It's almost as if they’re misspelling on purpose! I don’t think this has ever happened!
Chaitanya’s not even taking his time. Something is up. Chaitanya sits back down.
Just spell the fucking words. All you have to do is spell.
Same with you.
Eat shit, Chaiwala! Chaitanya stands.
Guys stands.
Chaitanya kicks Guy in the BALLS! Guy instantly buckles f the pain, falling to his knees.
oh!
Oh God.  96. Without raising his head Guy SUPERPUNCHES Chaitanya in th BALLS with his FIST!
Chaitanya goes down. Overwhelmed with pain, they both rol on the stage floor for a beat.

head_text.subj: OH MY GRAVY THIS HAS TURNED UGLY

text: Chaitanya leaps on top of Guy, raining wild haymakers dow him. Everyone watches in horror as they plow through empty fol chairs and off the stage to the floor.
Bowman is joined by the Judges as he clambers into the sc to pull Chaitanya and Guy apart. The audience screams in a frenzy.
Knock it off! Both of you! Chaitanya takes a final swing at Guy and mistakenly conne WITH BOWMAN’S NOSE! Blood erupts from his face and down h dapper suit.
oO
Oh shit! Sorry! Judges force Guy and Chaitanya back in their seats, leavi them sitting next to each other, heaving from the brawl. Using his handkerchief to stop the blood, Bowman huddles the judges.
I just, really don’t know what to say, Chuck.  97.

Well, right now, I’m sure President Bowman is looking to disqualify one or both of our finalists, Pete. Let’s look at the replay of the inciting incident. A SLOW-MO of Chaitanya winding up and kicking Guy in the balls replays over and over.
As you can see, Chaitanya really connected to Guy’s scrotal theater of pain.
My theater hurts just watching the replay. Bowman departs from the Judge’s table and sits back down.
Gentleman, it has been decided that neither one of you will be disqualified as you both- The audience’s boos become uproarious. PROCTOR (CONT’D) (shouting over boos)

head_text.subj: -AS YOU BOTH APPEAR TO HAVE EQUALLY

text: MANNER! NOW LET’S FINISH THE
The audience quiets down. PROCTOR (CONT’D) Now, can we please proceed? Guy gets up with a huff. Walks to the mic. PROCTOR (CONT’D) Unguent.
Ting! Guy sits back down with a “fuck you” face to Chaitanya. Chaitanya gets to the mic.  98.
Please consider carefully...for the love of God...the word...Bucentaur.
Chaitanya looks at Guy. The entire audience holds their breath.
Shopper stand frozen in front of the flatscreens.
The wife squeezes the husbands hand in hopeful anticipati
The troops all lean in close to the small TV.
Ting! The crowd erupts with disappointment.
The shoppers all scream “NOOOOOO!”
The wife beats her husband with a decorative pillow.
The troops all stomp and kick with frustration.
Guy sighs. Gets back up to the mic.
Sisyphean.
c-I-S-S-Y. Guy sits back down.
That’s not even complete! He just spelled Cissy! Chaitanya gets back up to the mic. The audience cheers fo him once again.
Please. For the love of mercy, carefully, very carefully consider the word Callithump.
Guy’s had enough, he gets up and walks over to Chaitanya.
It's C-A-L-I-T-H-U-M-P.
No, you forgot an L. Guy stands back, knowing what’s next.
Ruh-Roh. Bowman storms onto the stage- his eyes already starting t “raccoon” from the broken nose.  100.
Stop! Stop. I’m sorry. Sir, you were trying to help a fellow competitor cheat, that is against the rules, you are disqualified.
(rote) But it doesn’t matter, I spelled it wrong, anyway. He corrected me. The audience boos.
Which means that even though you tried to help him cheat, he wasn’t cheating and he still technically spelled the word correctly on his own, WHICH MAKES HIM THE NEW
The audience explodes with cheers.
The wife french kisses her husband while the dog watches.
Employees and shoppers cheer and hug each other.
Bar goers cheer and order rounds of shots
Soldiers cheers and hug and run out to fire their machine guns.

Chaitanya’s parents run up on stage to hug and kiss him amongst the growing crowd as balloons shower down in the auditorium.  101. A giant check and trophy table are whisked in from the wi as Guy quietly moves toward the exit. Chaitanya cranes hi head to look for Guy.
Guy smiles, shrugs and flips him the bird. Chuck and Pete appear next to Chaitanya.
Well, it was a battle royal for the ages. And now it is over. Many have gone home defeated. And one grabbed the brass ring.
Hi, Chuck.
And now the trophy ceremony. President Bowman?

Chaitanya Chopra, it is my great honor to bestow upon you the first place trophy for this year’s Scribbs National Spelling Bee, as well as a check for five hundred thousand dollars and a life-time supply of encyclopedias. Everyone applauds. Bowman hands Chaitanya the giant check and trophy. Chaitanya, holds the spelling bee trophy up in the air.
Chaitanya, how do you feel now that you’re champion?
I don’t consider myself the champion. I consider myself a co- champion with Guy. I thought it was unfair to disqualify Guy. GUY!

Suddenly a spotlight finds Guy just as he’s about to leav the auditorium. Guy turns around. CHAITANYA (CONT’D) Come back! Get up here!  102. Guy watches as Chaitanya pleads on stage. He heads back. Some people in the audience boo, but nobody cares. Guy tentatively gets back on stage. CHAITANYA (CONT’D) Guy is my friend. And I’ve decided to split the prize money with him.
(touched) Really?
That's what real friends do. Chaitanya holds out his hand. Guy goes in for a shake.
That’s pretty incredible. Among many many other things this year, I think we’ve all witnessed what true sportsmanship is here at the Bee. Sort of.
Guy exits the auditorium and spots Jenny at the check-out counter.
Jenny.
What.
Come with me. Guy leads Jenny to where Bowman stands, chatting to a clu of people.
Bowman. I need to talk to you. Bowman nods to the people and they depart. He uncomfortab looks at Guy.
What can I uh...do for you?  103.

My mom, in her day, used to work in a diner in Kansas City. And every so often this business man would come through town, apparently. He started off as an encyclopedia salesman and finished by leaving her with a baby. That baby was me. I’m your son and I just want to say, FUCK YOU and this is a reporter friend of mine who is going to write an entire article about it whether you like it or not! Mr. Bowman’s face goes slack. Jenny is incredibly touched Guy's gesture. Guy tensely waits to see what Bowman says next, preparing for the worst.
Oh my. You...you have her eyes.
I’M NOT FUCKING LYING- what?
I’ve only had one regret in life, and that was walking away from you and Bernice. I thought I had my reasons, but none of them really feel like good reasons, now. How is Berni-
Dead.
Oh. I’m sorry.
Yeah well...it’s no skin off your back. Guy turns to leave.
Wait! Guy stops.
Look. I was supposed to be on a plane out of here today, but let me reschedule. (MORE )
Meet me at the bar in an hour. We'll talk. I want to talk. Bowman sincerely hopes Guy says yes.
Okay.
Okay. Good. One hour. Bowman puts his hand on Guy’s shoulder and smiles reassuringly, then walks off.
Wow.
You can say that again.
Thanks for the scoop.
Jenny, I fuckin’ like you. Jenny smiles.
Good.
And it looks like I have an hour before I meet back up with...Dad. A sly grin spreads on Jenny’s face. She knows what he’s thinking.
Guy and Jenny hump passionately. Guy’s face is turned awa
Okay. ..NOW! Guy turns and locks eyes with Jenny. They both smile.  105.
Holy shit that was easier than I thought...aahhhh YES! YES! YES!

The marquee outside reads “CONGRATULATIONS TO CHAITANYA CHOPRA- NATIONAL SPELLING BEE CHAMP!” We pan down as school lets out. Chaitanya walks along wit his full backpack and armful of books. Three kids on bikes approach.

head_text.subj: HEY SPELLING NERD, CAN YOU SPELL

text: Of course. But not for you. The other kid SLAPS THE BOOKS OUT OF CHAITANYA’S ARMS, sending them everywhere. The three kids laugh and ride off. Nobody tries to help Chaitanya.
Hey, Slum Dog. Chaitanya looks up to see a POLICE CAR pulled to the curb with Guy smiling behind the wheel. Chaitanya leaves his m and walks over.
Wow!
Right?
Where'd you get this?
It’s an old movie police car. I got it at an auction with my half of the winnings. Worth every penny.  106.
Now you don’t need the toy you have the real thing!
But only because of my good friend. So, you want to give it a whirl?
Who? Me?
Damn fucking straight. I just thought you might want to show it off to some of your...classmates.
The three bully kids casually ride their bikes down the middle of the sleepy street... SIRENS GO OFF BEHIND THEM. They spin around to see CHAITANYA BEHIND THE WHEEL.
Chaitanya punches it as the three kids ride their bikes a fast as their feet can peddle.

A high speed chase! As the police car tears after the three screaming kids on their bikes...through the streets, over lawns, through parking lots. And all the while we hear Chaitanya and Guy laughing together. Like friends do.
